meanings.definition: To live longer than someone else.
meanings.sent2: The tortoise is outliving the hare in this race.
meanings.sent3: The old oak tree is outliving all the other trees in the forest.
meanings.sent4: His legacy will outlive him, like a shadow cast by the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins stand as a testament to outliving time itself.

meanings.definition: To continue to exist or be relevant longer than expected.
meanings.sent1: The classic novel is outliving many modern bestsellers.
meanings.sent2: Her wise advice is outliving the passing trends.
meanings.sent3: The durable toy is outliving all the other toys in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: The memory of her kindness will outlive her physical presence.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tradition is outliving the changes of the modern world.
